units.title: Multiplexed immunohistochemistry on FFPE sections
units.text: For each retinal organoid and the primary adult tissue, we performed multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3-μm-thick formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample; Supplementary Table 1 and Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Describes the core tissue preparation step for protein imaging.

units.title: Image acquisition at high magnification
units.text: We generated tiled images at ×40 magnification with a high-numerical-aperture (NA) silicone oil objective to cover length scales from the millimeter to the nanometer scale (pixel size, 0.1625 μm) with single-cell transcriptomes enabled cell type assignment to each nuclei cluster.
units.rationale: Specifies how images were captured for downstream analysis.

units.title: Establishing antibody panel
units.text: We established a panel of 63 antibodies covering major retinal cell types, subcellular compartments, morphological structures and signaling pathways split into three color channels (Supplementary Table 1).
units.rationale: Lists the reagents needed for multiplexed protein detection.

units.title: Performing imaging cycles
units.text: To achieve multiplexing, we aligned images across all cycles, allowing simultaneous display of any protein stain (Supplementary Figs. 1c–f and 2a,b).
units.rationale: Details the iterative imaging and alignment process.

units.title: Laminator algorithm for laminar segmentation
units.text: We developed a computational approach to reconstruct organoid laminar structure dynamics from multiplexed imaging data. This method (termed multi-plexed tissue units (MTUs))22, nuclei segmentation (~330,000 nuclei) (Laminator) establishes a contour around the organoid; segments and orients adjacent laminar windows circumference-spanning each organoid; quantifies signals across laminar windows; analyzes laminar window heterogeneity; and applies graph embedding and diffusion analysis for trajectory reconstruction (Fig. 2a).
units.rationale: Provides the software pipeline for extracting laminar windows.

units.title: Diffusion analysis for trajectory reconstruction
units.text: Global MTU analysis revealed diffusion analysis for trajectory reconstruction (Fig. 2a).
units.rationale: Specifies the analytical method used to infer developmental trajectories.

units.title: Combined scRNA‑seq and scATAC‑seq profiling
units.text: we performed scRNA‑seq and scATAC‑seq from the same cell suspension across a timecourse (6–46 weeks) of human retinal organoid development (Fig. 3a).
units.rationale: Describes the multimodal sequencing step that complements imaging data.

units.title: Mosaic genetic perturbation via lentiviral gRNA library
units.text: organoids were infected with gRNA‑containing lentiviruses at 19 weeks, and the pooled lentiviral library at 19 weeks of development, to investigate the role of the TFs in a timepoint in which all cell types are already present.

units.title: Sorting GFP+ cells post‑infection
units.text: At 3–5 weeks after infection, GFP+ cells were sorted and used to assess intra‑organoid and inter‑organoid heterogeneity.
units.rationale: Details the cell isolation step for downstream analysis of perturbed cells.

units.title: Establishing spatial retinal organoid reference map
units.text: To establish a spatial retinal organoid reference map, we applied 4i covering a timecourse of human retinal organoid development (6, 12, 18, 24 and 39 weeks; 2–4 organoids per timepoint; Supplementary Table 1) as well as an adult primary human retina (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Summarizes the overall workflow for generating the spatial reference dataset.
